Now, the code structure:

program main

    implicit none

    integer :: num, fine, c, second_result, ans, i, j, k, top, remainder
    character(len=20) :: s_fine, temp_str
    character(len=1), dimension(20) :: stack
    character(len=1), allocatable, dimension(:, :) :: arr

    read(*,*) num
    allocate(arr(num, num)) do i = 1, num
        read(*, '(a)') temp_str
        do j = 1, num
            arr(j, i) = temp_str(j:j)
        end do
    end do

    ! Compute fine
    fine = 0
    ! Columns
    do i = 1, num
        integer :: counter = 0
        do k = 1, num
            if (arr(k, i) == 'C') then
                counter = counter + 1
            end if
        end do
        fine = fine + counter * (counter - 1) / 2
    end do
    ! Rows
    do i = 1, num
        integer :: counter = 0
        do k = 1, num
            if (arr(i, k) == 'C') then
                counter = counter + 1
            end if
        end do
        fine = fine + counter * (counter - 1) / 2
    end do

    ! Convert fine to string
    write(s_fine, '(i0)') fine
    s_fine = adjustl(s_fine)  !
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
Ensure no leading spaces

    ! Process stack
    c = 0
    top = 0 do i = 1, len_trim(s_fine)
        character(len=1) :: char = s_fine(i:i)
        top = top + 1
        stack(top) = char
        do
            if (top < 2) exit
            character(len=1) :: p = stack(top)
            character(len=1) :: q = stack(top-1)
            if ( (p == '0' .and. q == '1') .or. (p == '1' .and. q == '0') ) then
                c = c + 1
                top = top - 2
            else
                exit
            end if
        end do
    end do

    second_result = 2 * c

    ! Third step: count 1s in binary of second_result
    ans = 0
    n = second_result
    do while (n > 0)
        remainder = mod(n, 2)
        if (remainder == 1) then
            ans = ans + 1
        end if
        n = n / 2
    end do

    print*, ans

    deallocate(arr)

end program main

program main
    implicit none

    integer :: num, fine, c, second_result, ans, i, j, k, top, remainder, counter
    character(len=1), allocatable, dimension(:, :) :: arr
    character(len=1), dimension(20) :: stack
    character(len=1), dimension(:), allocatable :: temp_str

    read(*,*) num
    allocate(arr(num, num))

    do i = 1, num
        allocate(temp_str(num))
        read(*, '(a)') temp_str
        do j = 1, num
            arr(j, i) = temp_str(j)
        end do
        deallocate(temp_str)
    end do

    ! Compute fine
    fine = 0
    ! Columns
    do i = 1, num
        counter = 0
        do k = 1, num
            if (arr(k, i) == 'C') then
                counter = counter + 1
            end if
        end do
        fine = fine + counter * (counter - 1) / 2
    end do
    ! Rows
    do i = 1, num
        counter = 0
        do k = 1, num
            if (arr(i, k) == 'C') then
                counter = counter + 1
            end if
        end do
        fine = fine + counter * (counter - 1) / 2
    end do

    ! Convert fine to string
    character(len=20) :: s_fine
    write(s_fine, '(i0)') fine
    s_fine = adjustl(s_fine)

    ! Process stack
    c = 0
    top = 0 do i = 1, len_trim(s_fine)
        character(len=1) :: char = s_fine(i:i)
        top = top + 1
        stack(top) = char
        do
            if (top < 2) exit
            character(len=1) :: p = stack(top)
            character(len=1) :: q = stack(top-1)
            if ( (p == '0' .and. q == '1') .or. (p == '1' .and. q == '0') ) then
                c = c + 1
                top = top - 2
            else
                exit
            end if
        end do
    end do

    second_result = 2 * c

    ! Third step: count 1s in binary of second_result
    ans = 0
    n = second_result
    do while (n > 0)
        remainder = mod(n, 2)
        if (remainder == 1) then
            ans = ans + 1
        end if
        n = n / 2
    end do

    print*, ans

    deallocate(arr)

end program main

Now, the code structure:

program main

    implicit none

    integer :: num, fine, c, second_result, ans, i, j, k, top, remainder
    character(len=20) :: s_fine, temp_str
    character(len=1), dimension(20) :: stack
    character(len=1), allocatable, dimension(:, :) :: arr

    read(*,*) num
    allocate(arr(num, num))

    do i = 1, num
        read(*, '(a)') temp_str
        do j = 1, num
            arr(j, i) = temp_str(j:j)
        end do
    end do

    ! Compute fine
    fine = 0
    ! Columns
    do i = 1, num
        integer :: counter = 0
        do k = 1, num
            if (arr(k, i) == 'C') then
                counter = counter + 1
            end if
        end do
        fine = fine + counter * (counter - 1) / 2
    end do
    ! Rows
    do i = 1, num
        integer :: counter = 0
        do k = 1, num
            if (arr(i, k) == 'C') then
                counter = counter + 1
            end if
        end do
        fine = fine + counter * (counter - 1) / 2
    end do

    ! Convert fine to string
    write(s_fine, '(i0)') fine
    s_fine = adjustl(s_fine)  ! Ensure no leading spaces

    ! Process stack
    c = 0
    top = 0
    do i = 1, len_trim(s_fine)
        character(len=1) :: char = s_fine(i:i)
        top = top + 1
        stack(top) = char
        do
            if (top < 2) exit
            character(len=1) :: p = stack(top)
            character(len=1) :: q = stack(top-1)
            if ( (p == '0' .and. q == '1') .or. (p == '1' .and. q == '0') ) then
                c = c + 1
                top = top - 2
            else
                exit
            end if
        end do
    end do

    second_result = 2 * c

    ! Third step: count 1s in binary of second_result
    ans = 0
    n = second_result
    do while (n > 0)
        remainder = mod(n, 2)
        if (remainder == 1) then
            ans = ans + 1
        end if
        n = n / 2
    end do

    print*, ans

    deallocate(arr)

end program main

The final code:

program main
    implicit none

    integer :: num, fine, c, second_result, ans, i, j, k, top, remainder, counter
    character(len=1), allocatable, dimension(:, :) :: arr
    character(len=1), dimension(20) :: stack
    character(len=1), dimension(:), allocatable :: temp_str

    read(*,*) num
    allocate(arr(num, num))

    do i = 1, num
        allocate(temp_str(num))
        read(*, '(a)') temp_str
        do j = 1, num
            arr(j, i) = temp_str(j)
        end do
        deallocate(temp_str)
    end do

    ! Compute fine
    fine = 0
    ! Columns
    do i = 1, num
        counter = 0
        do k = 1, num
            if (arr(k, i) == 'C') then
                counter = counter + 1
            end if
        end do
        fine = fine + counter * (counter - 1) / 2
    end do
    ! Rows
    do i = 1, num
        counter = 0
        do k = 1, num
            if (arr(i, k) == 'C') then
                counter = counter + 1
            end if
        end do
        fine = fine + counter * (counter - 1) / 2
    end do

    ! Convert fine to string
    character(len=20) :: s_fine
    write(s_fine, '(i0)') fine
    s_fine = adjustl(s_fine)

    ! Process stack
    c = 0
    top = 0
    do i = 1, len_trim(s_fine)
        character(len=1) :: char = s_fine(i:i)
        top = top + 1
        stack(top) = char
        do
            if (top < 2) exit
            character(len=1) :: p = stack(top)
            character(len=1) :: q = stack(top-1)
            if ( (p == '0' .and. q == '1') .or. (p == '1' .and. q == '0') ) then
                c = c + 1
                top = top - 2
            else
                exit
            end if
        end do
    end do

    second_result = 2 * c

    ! Third step: count 1s in binary of second_result
    ans = 0
    n = second_result
    do while (n > 0)
        remainder = mod(n, 2)
        if (remainder == 1) then
            ans = ans + 1
        end if
        n = n / 2
    end do

    print*, ans

    deallocate(arr)

end program main
